input: premise: The Walloon Legion (French: "Légion Wallonie" ) was a collaborationist volunteer unit recruited from Belgium's French-speaking population in Wallonia and Brussels during the German occupation of World War II. The Walloon Legion served in the Wehrmacht, later in the Waffen-SS, on the Eastern Front on both front line and reserve duties. [SEP] hypothesis: There are some French speakers in Brussels.

premise: Il trionfo dell'onore ("The Triumph of Honour") is an operatic 'commedia' in three acts by the Italian composer Alessandro Scarlatti, with a libretto by . It was first performed at the Teatro dei Fiorentini, Naples on 26 November 1718. It is Scarlatti's only known comic opera. [SEP] hypothesis: Il trionfo dell'onore is no doubt going to be remember until the end of time.

premise: Jose “Poli” Garcia (born in San Diego, California) is a retired American soccer player. He spent at least four seasons in the American Soccer League, three in the North American Soccer League and four in the Major Indoor Soccer League. He was the 1979 American Soccer League MVP and earned two caps with the United States in 1975. [SEP] hypothesis: Jose “Poli” Garcia (born in San Jose, California) is a retired American soccer player.

premise: Simonstone is a small village and civil parish in the Ribble Valley district of Lancashire, England. The population of the civil parish taken at the 2011 census was 1,154. It is about 4 mi west of Burnley and south of Pendle Hill and Clitheroe along the A671 road. The village adjoins the village of Read, Lancashire and neighbours Padiham. [SEP] hypothesis: simonstone is not a large village

premise: Gunsmoke Western was an American comic book series published initially by Atlas Comics, the 1950s forerunner of Marvel Comics, and then into the 1960s by Marvel. A Western anthology that ran 46 issues, it featured early stories of the Marvel Old West heroes Kid Colt and the Two-Gun Kid, and work by such artists as Jack Kirby, John Severin, Joe Maneely, Doug Wildey, and many others. [SEP] hypothesis: Gunsmoke Western was an American comic book series that featured work by such artists as Jack Kirby, John Severin, Joe Maneely, Doug Wildey, and many others.

premise: The 2010 SMU Mustangs football team represented Southern Methodist University in the 2010 NCAA Division I FBS football season. The Mustangs, led by third-year head coach June Jones, were members of Conference USA in the West Division and played their home games at Gerald J. Ford Stadium. [SEP] hypothesis: The Mustangs represent the Southern Methodist University.

premise: The 1919 NCAA football season had no clear-cut champion, with the "Official NCAA Division I Football Records Book" listing Centre, Harvard, Illinois, Notre Dame, and Texas A&M as having been deemed national champions by major selectors Only Harvard, Illinois, and Texas A&M claim national championships for the 1919 season. Texas A&M began claiming the 1919 national championship in 2012. [SEP] hypothesis: The NCAA's top championship teams include Harvard, Illinois, and Notre Dame

premise: Friedrich Wilhelm Konrad von Brodowski, known at "Fritz", (November 26, 1886 – October 28, 1944) was a German army general, controversially killed while in French custody during World War II. His death led to the murder, by way of a reprisal, of an imprisoned French army general, Gustave Mesny. [SEP] hypothesis: Fritz was killed in French custody.

premise: Lee Il-hyung is a South Korean film director and screenwriter. Prior to directing his first feature film "A Violent Prosecutor" (2016), Lee is an assistant director on films, such as "The Moonlight of Seoul" (2008), "My Way" (2011) and "" (2014), and commercial films. [SEP] hypothesis: The Moonlight of Seoul came out in 2007

premise: James Arthur Lovell Jr. (born March 25, 1928) is a former NASA astronaut and a retired captain in the United States Navy, most famous as the commander of the Apollo 13 mission, which suffered a critical failure en route to the Moon but was brought back safely to Earth by the efforts of the crew and mission control. [SEP] hypothesis: Apollo 13 spent the entire trip back to Earth in space after suffering a critical failure on it's way to the moon.

premise: The 1947 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College in the Pacific Coast Conference (PCC) during the 1947 college football season. Phil Sarboe, in his third of five seasons as head coach at Washington State, led the team to a 2–5 mark in the PCC and 3–7 overall. [SEP] hypothesis: Sarboe was coach for at least three seasons at Washington State

premise: The Office is a British mockumentary sitcom, first broadcast in the United Kingdom on BBC Two on 9 July 2001. Created, written and directed by Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant, the programme is about the day-to-day lives of office employees in the Slough branch of the fictitious Wernham Hogg Paper Company. Gervais also stars in the series, playing the central character, David Brent. [SEP] hypothesis: Other Mockumentaries have played out on BBC

premise: Almost Sunrise is a 2016 American documentary film directed by Michael Collins. It recounts the story of two Iraq veterans, Tom Voss and Anthony Anderson, who, in an attempt to put their combat experience behind them, embark on a 2,700-mile trek on foot across America. It made its world premiere on the opening night of the Telluride Mountainfilm Festival on 27 May, 2016. [SEP] hypothesis: Tom Voss and Anthony Anderson treked 3,000 miles across America in the documentary.

premise: Safe is a 2012 American action crime thriller film written and directed by Boaz Yakin and starring Jason Statham, Chris Sarandon, Robert John Burke and James Hong. Statham plays an ex-cop and former cage fighter who winds up protecting a gifted child who is being chased by the Russian mafia, Chinese Triads, and corrupt New York City police. [SEP] hypothesis: Safe was a box office success.

premise: The Scarlet Letter (stylized The SCARlet Letter) is the fifth studio album by American recording artist Lil' Mo. It was first released on October 27, 2014 by Penalty Entertainment. Its first and only single, "Should've Never Let You Go" preceded its release on September 23, 2014. [SEP] hypothesis: The Scarlet Letter (stylized The SCARlet Letter) is the fifth studio album by American recording artist Lil' Moss.

premise: Suzy Nakamura is an American actress. Nakamura is known for her many guest appearances on sitcoms such as "According to Jim", "Half and Half", "8 Simple Rules", "Curb Your Enthusiasm" and "How I Met Your Mother" and her recurring role in the early seasons of the drama "The West Wing" as assistant to the Sam Seaborn character, as well as Dr. Miura in the ABC sitcom "Modern Family". [SEP] hypothesis: Suzy did not appear in "The West Wing".
